title: Textile, early 20th century
medium:
Medium: cotton, silk
Technique: wax resist dyeing (batik) on plain weave; discontinuous supplementary weft patterning (brocade); printed (prada)
description: Narrow length of dark blue cotton with all-over batik pattern in light brown. Pattern features "sawat" motif (wings and tail of Garuda, mount of Vishnu) among other designs. On one side, batiked areas painted over in gold (prada technique). End borders on dark blue side block printed. Piece edged with narrow red silk borders with floral pattern brocaded in gold and silver.

tombstone.epitaph:
Textile, early 20th century.
early 20th century. Medium: cotton, silk
Technique: wax resist dyeing (batik) on plain weave; discontinuous supplementary weft patterning (brocade); printed (prada). Gift of Mrs. Calvin Stillman. 1965-24-3.
